publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2744 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Recycling of Household Waste-That the Parliament recognises the recent report by the Accounts Commission, Performance Indicators 2000/2001: Environmental and Regulatory Services - Comparing the Performance of Scottish Councils, showing that Argyll and Bute Council recycled almost twice as much household waste as the national average; congratulates all those in the community who are involved on their efforts, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to continue to press for more of our waste to be recycled.
S1M-2744 Recycling of Household Waste (lodged on 13 February 2002) Stewart Stevenson*

S1M-2744 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Recycling of Household Wasteâ€”That the Parliament recognises the recent report by the Accounts Commission, Performance Indicators 2000/2001: Environmental and Regulatory Services - Comparing the Performance of Scottish Councils, showing that Argyll and Bute Council recycled almost twice as much household waste as the national average; congratulates all those in the community who are involved on their efforts, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to continue to press for more of our waste to be recycled. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson
S1M-2744 Recycling of Household Waste (lodged on 13 February 2002) Robin Harper*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-2744 Recycling of Household Waste (lodged on 13 February 2002) Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-2744 Recycling of Household Waste (lodged on 13 February 2002) Maureen Macmillan*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-2744 Recycling of Household Waste (lodged on 13 February 2002) Jackie Baillie*
S1M-2744 Recycling of Household Waste (lodged on 13 February 2002) Linda Fabiani*
S1M-2744 Recycling of Household Waste (lodged on 13 February 2002) Robert Brown*
S1M-2744 Recycling of Household Waste (lodged on 13 February 2002) Dr Winnie Ewing*
